thread.title: Radio Waves: WNTI-FM will live on by streaming online - Entertainment News
thread.title_full: Radio Waves: WNTI-FM will live on by streaming online - Entertainment News - NorthJersey.com

author: Ray Edel
title: Radio Waves: WNTI-FM will live on by streaming online - Entertainment News
text:
WNTI-FM's (91.9) station and license were recently sold by Centenary College to Philadelphia-based WXPN-FM (88.5). 
But the format — along with the programs and on-air personalities — will continue to live on, streaming online at wnti.org.
To celebrate the "new-old" WNTI, a live event will take place from 5 to 6 p.m. next Friday at the Lakeland Center parking lot on the campus of the college, 715 Grand St., Hackettstown.
The hourlong celebration will include a ribbon-cutting ceremony, speakers and live music. 
Pat DiNizio, of The Smithereens, has been confirmed to "perform a song or two." Additional performers will be announced at a later date.
A memorial WNTI t-shirt, with logo on the front and "Where Great Music Still Lives" printed on the back, will be given away.
The show will be simulcast live and streamed at wnti.org.
*
Starting Monday, E! news co-anchor, producer, actress and author Maria Menounos will host "Conversations With Maria Menounos," a new, live daily radio show on SiriusXM.
The program will feature interviews with celebrities, leaders in entertainment and the news, and influential guests who will share their inspirations, personal stories, life journeys and expertise. 
Running from 1 to 2 p.m. weekdays, the program will broadcast from SiriusXM's studio in Los Angeles and air on Stars channel 109.
*
The website allaccess.com features two new regular columns:
* "Perry on Podcasting" offers tips and guidance for podcasters from Perry Michael Simon, All Access news-talk-sports editor, "The Letter" columnist and director of programming for the Nerdist Podcast Network. 
* "Broadcaster Meets Podcaster" focuses on the bridge between radio and podcasting, with Jacobs Media's Digital Dot Connector and All Access "Next Steps" columnist Seth Resler offering ideas and guidance for radio people looking to move into podcasting, or considering adding podcasts to their present duties. 
Listeners can find the new podcast section at allaccess.com/pod cast. 
*
WFUV-FM (90.7) has announced the lineup for the 11th annual "Holiday Cheer for FUV" concert, which will take place at the Beacon Theatre 8 p.m. Dec. 4.
This year's theme is "Brandi Carlile & Friends," featuring Dawes, Sharon Jones & the Dap-Kings, and more artists to be announced.
Tickets for the concert, which benefits the public radio station, go on sale at 10 a.m. today through ticketmaster.com.
*
